#summary Data Becker File Format Specification

= Data Becker FChronik - File Format Specification =

The _Data Becker Familienchronik_ family tree software uses a proprietary file format to save it's genealogy data.

The file starts with four magic bytes, followed by datasets, one dataset per person.
 * 04 bytes: magic <0x01> <0x00> <0x00> <0x00>

One dataset consist of exactly 1100 bytes each. Encoding is standard ASCII. Explicit qualifiers, e.g. the gender, are german.
 * 20 bytes: last name, aligned right
 * 20 bytes: last name
 * 20 bytes: first name
 * 20 bytes: first name
 * 10 bytes: spaces?
 * 10 bytes: date, represented with ASCII digits as *DD.MM.YYYY*
 * 30 bytes: town, aligned left
 * 10 bytes: spaces?
 * 10 bytes: date
 * 30 bytes: town
 * 08 bytes: gender, either *weiblich* (female) or *männlich* (male)
 * 12 bytes: religious denomination, aligned left, e.g. *evangelisch* or *katholisch*
 * 434 bytes: profession, aligned left
 * 12 bytes: unknown binary coded information
 * 10 bytes: date
 * 30 bytes: town
 * 76 bytes: unknown binary coded information
 * 40 bytes: unknown string
 * 76 bytes: unknown binary coded information
 * 40 bytes: unknown string
 * 76 bytes: unknown binary coded information
 * 40 bytes: unknown string
 * 76 bytes: unknown binary coded information

All strings are padded with spaces. <0x20>
Binary encoded information is padded with zeroes. <0x00>

In german special vowels exist, ä, ö and ü, as well as a special s, the ß. Their hexadecimal representations are:
 * ä <0xE4>
 * ö <0xF6>
 * ü <0xFC>
 * ß <0xDF>
